HomePage.title: Bitswipe
HomePage.description: Bitswipe is a cryptocurrency trading simulation game that helps you master Bitcoin trading without risk. Practice reading candlestick charts, predicting price movements, and sharpen your technical analysis skills with this addictive crypto trading simulation game. Or, simply enjoy the fun!
HomePage.keywords: Bitcoin Trading Simulator,Crypto Trading Game,Practice Trading,Technical Analysis,Candlestick Charts,Crypto Game,Bitcoin Price Prediction,Bitcoin Paper Trading,Chart Trading,Bitcoin Futures,Bitcoin Leverage,Bitcoin Position
HomePage.ogDescription: Master Bitcoin Trading through a Game. Learn while enjoying a simulation game that lets you practice reading charts and predicting price movements.

AnalysisModal.your_behavior_patterns_in_different_mark: Your behavior patterns in different market conditions

Psychology.title: The Psychology of Trading: Why Games Like BitSwipe Matter
Psychology.p1: Trading is often 20% strategy and 80% psychology. Many traders fail not because they lack technical knowledge, but because they cannot control their emotions—fear, greed, and FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out).
Psychology.p2_part1: serves as a risk-free "flight simulator" for traders. By compressing hours of market action into minutes, it allows you to:
Psychology.list1_text: Learn to make quick decisions under pressure without risking real capital.
Psychology.list2_text: Train your eyes to spot chart patterns like Head & Shoulders, Flags, and Wedges in real-time.
Psychology.list3_text: Experience the consequences of over-leveraging and poor position sizing in a safe environment.
Psychology.p3: Whether you are a seasoned pro looking to stay sharp or a beginner taking your first steps into the crypto world, BitSwipe provides the perfect arena to hone your skills and build the mental discipline required for successful trading.

Mission.title: Why Bitswipe?
Mission.p1: I created Bitswipe to bridge the gap between boring study and the thrill of live trading. Many aspiring traders struggle with the slow pace of real-time mock trading—waiting hours for a setup to form.
Mission.p2_data: real historical Bitcoin data for 1 year
Mission.p2_part2: to create a fast-paced, intuitive web game. It allows you to experience months of market movements in minutes, helping you recognize patterns faster. Our goal is to provide a platform where you can test your intuition, analyze your win rates detailedly, and easily share your achievements with friends—all while having fun without the financial risk.

Basics.title: Mastering the Basics: Essential Trading Skills
Basics.p1: Before diving into complex indicators, every trader must master the fundamentals. Here are three core concepts you can practice right now in BitSwipe:
Basics.concept1_text: Prices rarely move in a straight line. Look for "floors" where price bounces up (Support) and "ceilings" where it gets rejected (Resistance). Buying at support and selling at resistance is a classic strategy.
Basics.concept2_text: "The trend is your friend." In an uptrend, look for Higher Highs and Higher Lows. In a downtrend, watch for Lower Highs and Lower Lows. Don't fight the trend unless you see a clear reversal signal.
Basics.concept3_text: Long wicks indicate rejection. A long wick at the top means sellers pushed the price down (bearish). A long wick at the bottom means buyers pushed it up (bullish). Pay attention to the shape of the candles!

ChartPatterns.title: Mastering Chart Patterns
ChartPatterns.pattern1_text: A bearish reversal pattern. It has three peaks: a higher middle peak (head) between two smaller peaks (shoulders). Breaking the "neckline" support often signals a price drop.
ChartPatterns.pattern2_text: A bullish reversal pattern looking like a "W". It indicates the price has hit a support level twice and failed to break lower. Breaking the upper resistance confirms the uptrend.
ChartPatterns.pattern3_text: A bullish continuation pattern. After a sharp rise (the pole), prices consolidate downwards in a channel (the flag) before breaking out higher again.
ChartPatterns.pattern4_text: A bearish reversal pattern looking like an "M". Price hits a resistance level twice and fails to break higher. Breaking the neckline support confirms the downtrend.

Advanced.title: Advanced Tools & Indicators
Advanced.p1_part1: Want to trade like a pro? Click the
Advanced.p1_part2: button in the top right corner to enable professional technical indicators.
Advanced.tool1_goal_text: Understand the high risks of leverage trading safely.
Advanced.tool1_lever_text: Amplifies both profits and losses. (e.g., 10x leverage turns a 1% move into 10%)
Advanced.tool1_liq_text: If your loss exceeds 100% of your margin (e.g., -2% move at 50x), you lose your entire bet.
Advanced.tool1_rule_text: Game Rule: If you are liquidated, the game ends immediately, regardless of remaining rounds. Use this to practice risk management!
Advanced.tool2_text: Measures the speed and change of price movements.
Advanced.tool3_text: Shows the average price over a specific period, smoothing out price fluctuations to identify the trend direction.
Advanced.tool4_text: A set of lines plotted two standard deviations (positively and negatively) away from a simple moving average.
Advanced.tool4_squeeze_text: Low volatility, often followed by a breakout.
Advanced.tool4_touch_text: Price touching the upper band may indicate overbought, lower band may indicate oversold.

HowToPlay.title: How to Play
HowToPlay.step1_text: Review the historical candlestick chart displayed on the card. Look for patterns, trends, and indicators.
HowToPlay.step2_text: Decide if the price will go up (Long), down (Short), or stay sideways (Hold).
HowToPlay.step3_text: Tap the 'Long' button to predict a rise, 'Short' for a drop, or 'Hold' to wait.
HowToPlay.step4_text: Experience immediate feedback with interactive visual effects that reveal your result right away.
HowToPlay.step5_text: Monitor your win rate and virtual profit to see how your trading skills improve over time.

Tips.title: Trading Tips for Beginners
Tips.p1: Successful trading requires discipline and strategy. Here are a few tips to keep in mind while playing Bitswipe:
Tips.tip1_text: It's often safer to trade in the direction of the overall trend rather than against it.
Tips.tip2_text: Don't jump into a trade too early. Wait for a candle to close to confirm a pattern.
Tips.tip3_text: In real trading, never risk more than you can afford to lose. Bitswipe lets you practice this mindset safely.
Tips.tip4_text: Analyze your losing trades to understand what went wrong. Was it a false breakout? Did you miss a support level?

Resources.title: Trusted Resources for Learning
Resources.p1: To further improve your trading skills, we recommend studying from reputable sources. Here are some trusted platforms where you can learn more about technical analysis:
Resources.link1_text: : Free educational resources on cryptocurrency trading and blockchain technology.
Resources.link2_text: : Comprehensive crypto learning platform covering trading basics, technical analysis, and market trends.

SEOContent.Disclaimer: Disclaimer: Bitswipe is a simulation game for entertainment and educational purposes only. It does not involve real money trading and does not constitute financial advice.

PrivacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.introP1: At Bitswipe, accessible from {url}, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by Bitswipe and how we use it.

logFiles.title: Log Files
logFiles.p1: Bitswipe follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. The information collected by log files include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), date and time stamp, referring/exit pages, and possibly the number of clicks. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the website, and gathering demographic information.

cookies.title: Cookies and Web Beacons
cookies.p1: Like any other website, Bitswipe uses 'cookies'. These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited. The information is used to optimize the users' experience by customizing our web page content based on visitors' browser type and/or other information.

googleDart.title: Google DoubleClick DART Cookie
googleDart.p1: Google is one of a third-party vendor on our site. It also uses cookies, known as DART cookies, to serve ads to our site visitors based upon their visit to {url} and other sites on the internet. However, visitors may choose to decline the use of DART cookies by visiting the Google ad and content network Privacy Policy at the following URL –

adPolicies.title: Privacy Policies
adPolicies.p1: You may consult this list to find the Privacy Policy for each of the advertising partners of Bitswipe.
adPolicies.p2: Third-party ad servers or ad networks uses technologies like cookies, JavaScript, or Web Beacons that are used in their respective advertisements and links that appear on Bitswipe, which are sent directly to users' browser. They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs. These technologies are used to measure the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns and/or to personalize the advertising content that you see on websites that you visit.
adPolicies.p3: Note that Bitswipe has no access to or control over these cookies that are used by third-party advertisers.

thirdParty.title: Third Party Privacy Policies
thirdParty.p1: Bitswipe's Privacy Policy does not apply to other advertisers or websites. Thus, we are advising you to consult the respective Privacy Policies of these third-party ad servers for more detailed information. It may include their practices and instructions about how to opt-out of certain options.

children.title: Children's Information
children.p1: Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.
children.p2: Bitswipe does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of {age}. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.

consent.title: Consent
consent.p1: By using our website, you hereby consent to our Privacy Policy and agree to its Terms and Conditions.

section1.title: 1. Terms
section1.p1: By accessing this Website, accessible from {url}, you are agreeing to be bound by these Website Terms and Conditions of Use and agree that you are responsible for the agreement with any applicable local laws. If you disagree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from accessing this site. The materials contained in this Website are protected by copyright and trade mark law.

section2.p2: This will let Bitswipe to terminate upon violations of any of these restrictions. Upon termination, your viewing right will also be terminated and you should destroy any downloaded materials in your possession whether it is printed or electronic format.

section3.title: 3. Disclaimer
section3.p1: All the materials on Bitswipe's Website are provided "as is". Bitswipe makes no warranties, may it be expressed or implied, therefore negates all other warranties. Furthermore, Bitswipe does not make any representations concerning the accuracy or likely reliability of the use of the materials on its Website or otherwise relating to such materials or any sites linked to this Website.
section3.importantText: Bitswipe is a simulation game for entertainment purposes only. It does not provide financial advice, and no real money is involved in the trading simulation. Past performance in the game does not guarantee future results in real-world trading.

section4.title: 4. Limitations
section4.p1: Bitswipe or its suppliers will not be hold accountable for any damages that will arise with the use or inability to use the materials on Bitswipe's Website, even if Bitswipe or an authorize representative of this Website has been notified, orally or written, of the possibility of such damage. Some jurisdiction does not allow limitations on implied warranties or limitations of liability for incidental damages, these limitations may not apply to you.

section5.title: 5. Revisions and Errata
section5.p1: The materials appearing on Bitswipe's Website may include technical, typographical, or photographic errors. Bitswipe will not promise that any of the materials in this Website are accurate, complete, or current. Bitswipe may change the materials contained on its Website at any time without notice. section6.title: 6. Links
section6.p1: Bitswipe has not reviewed all of the sites linked to its Website and is not responsible for the contents of any such linked site. The presence of any link does not imply endorsement by Bitswipe of the site. The use of any linked website is at the user's own risk.

section7.title: 7. Site Terms of Use Modifications
section7.p1: Bitswipe may revise these Terms of Use for its Website at any time without prior notice. By using this Website, you are agreeing to be bound by the current version of these Terms and Conditions of Use.

section9.title: 9. Governing Law
